channel.title: Nulls
channel.description: Can anyone tell me how to get rid of the nulls? I have tried different stuff sometimes my server gets flooded with them and sometimes it doesn't so i need an anti-null plz

item.title: Nulls
item.dc:creator: @newservermaker newservermaker
item.description:
@newservermaker wrote:

yes but mopar scape is based on the runescape cache, yes it is in java but some noobs are idiots and dont know that so i seid runescape cache. Still, java is based on useing multi language things, for americans like myself, it uses english langauge and german language, in some countries you get different forms useing 2 languages, the countrys main language and sertin german words.

bakatool:

lol if that was true jagex would have thousands of nulls daily lol naw its just a leak in the programming … if you miss a few checks when u program like lets say you are programming a code to kill NPC’s… you make it kill NPC right off a packet… but you don’t check if npc exists… if someone sends a bad packet like hes attacking lets say a fire gaint when he is only attacking a man… the server will give a error… its just part of programming if u miss some checks… u will have big problems.

very true

Read full topic

item.title: Nulls
item.dc:creator: @newservermaker newservermaker
item.description:
@newservermaker wrote:

you cant stop a null no matter what you add… Null means Zero in german, that is why moparscape cache has it. Its in the runescape cache… you cant get rid of it… if your stuck with a bunch of nulls… i suggest just rebooting the server…

Read full topic

item.title: Nulls
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

yes… but i did it in 2 statements because a player could be not null but still but the disconnected flag may still/was still set to and in some cases the playerName was set to null so kinda but than again… you could as well did it all in 1 line I wanted to see outputs of Systemout’s to see which was more likely to happen and thats why It’s soo weird.

you are right thats all thats missing

Read full topic

item.title: Nulls
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

first of all that will lag server way to much since its a loop that never stops going at very fast speeds draining alot of CPU usage

and why? when my Fix to Null’s is only 2 lines… and its possible to add to all bases.

this is how I added it… you can 95% replace your whole newPlayerClient method with this.

 public void newPlayerClient(java.net.Socket s, String connectedFrom) {
    // first, search for a free slot
    //int slot = -1, i = playerSlotSearchStart;
    int slot = -1, i = 1;
    
    do {
    
      if(players[i] == null) {
      	//System.out.println("[debug org] " + i + " is null reused check");
        slot = i;
        break;
      } else if(players[i].disconnected || players[i].playerName == null) { //more anti-null processes -bakatool
        //System.out.println("[debug dc] " + i + " is null reused check");
        slot = i;
      	break;
      }
      i++;
      if(i >= maxPlayers) i = 0;		// wrap around
    } while(i <= maxPlayers);
    
    //System.out.println("[debug org/dc] re-use: " + slot);
    ClientThread newClient = new ClientThread(s, slot);
    newClient.handler = this;
    (new Thread(newClient)).start();
    if(slot == -1) return;		// no free slot found - world is full
    players[slot] = newClient;
    players[slot].connectedFrom = connectedFrom;
    // start at next slot when issuing the next search to speed it up

    // Note that we don't use slot 0 because playerId zero does not function
    // properly with the server.client.
  }

and nullls are gone.

IF you see nulls in ::players thats because your ::players command is programmed incorrectly. Everytime you see a null in ::players it will be re-used when a player logs in… normally without this fix above the null will Never go away… I would add a null filtering code for not showing nulls that get reused on ::players

Read full topic

item.title: Nulls
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

sure to stop http crashers. like http://serverIP:serverPort/ and spamming refresh site that code above will stop those nulls.

but it won’t stop crashers that login real accounts… and logout over and over this problem will happen if lets say

players 0,1,2,3,4,5 are logged in

player 3 logs out… since after player 3 is 4 and 5…

3 turns to null… never getting used again.

if players 0,1,2,3,4,5 are logged in

player 5 logs out… player 5 gets removed good… no null… see?

if your in the middle you get nulled and never reused… thats the bug I fixed in PlayerHandler.java and it won’t crash server

if you have a SYIpkpkr spamming REAL logins really fast he would login alot of players and if max players is set to 128… so if 128 nulls are made… well lets say 127 nulls only 1 player can login / logout… cuz max limit is met.

Read full topic

item.title: Nulls
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

null is not a real player… so searching for a string called null in player name will do absolutely no good what so ever… null is a terminated class which has to be re-used later on… but unfortanly it isn’t the server in RS2 Downloads which is titled uncrashable new generation private server revolution (servers without lag or crashing) blah blah. if you look at PlayerHandler.java you will see my fix for null bug which re-uses null’d players instead of stuffing up all the player slots you have remaining right now.

Read full topic
